snippet: The fatal accident that left the actor Tracy Morgan injured brings attention to the lobbying efforts of the trucking industry.
abstract: Editorial condemns Senate Appropriations Committee decision to roll back regulations meant to keep fatigued truck drivers off roads; points to accident involving comedian Tracy Morgan, and says that current laws are too weak; urges Senate to resist pressures from trucking industry when voting on spending bill that includes requirement that truckers take at least 34 hours off after working 60 hours in seven consecutive days.
lead_paragraph: The fatal accident that left the actor Tracy Morgan injured brings attention to the lobbying efforts of the trucking industry.

headline.seo: The Trucking Industry Wants to Weaken Safety Rules
